raceinfo.text: We may not all be able to gather on Thanksgiving morning to run together as usual, but you'll still have an individualized bib with your race number!  Once you've registered, be sure to download your virtual bib.  You will need your bib number to enter your race results. You can also share your bib on social media and/or print it out to wear during the race.

Looking for a tool to help you set your own 5K or 1-mile course for this year's run?  We recommend Map My Run, which will enable you to create your own route or choose from popular nearby routes as you plan and train.  On Race Day, use any of your smart devices along with the app to track your route progress and time.

Download the official 2020 Mercer County Turkey Trot virtual race Spotify playlist!  Curated by the MCTT Race Committee, this playlist includes some of our favorites to get your heart pumping and keep you on track as you run.  Use it as you train over the next weeks and blast it out during your official run on Thanksgiving week!
Upload your race results.  After you enter your race results you will be able to upload your pictures.  You can also upload them directly to RunSignUp.
We want to see your smiling faces!  After you enter your race results you will be able to upload your pictures.  You can also upload them directly to RunSignUp.
